name: Camp Jabulani

reviews.text: After a warm welcome by Carl and a nice cocktail we discovered our suite nestled in the trees. Everything was beautiful from the viewing deck and the pool to the inside of the suite (check the pictures!). We then headed for lunch where we met the chef and the staff and enjoyed the first of many tasty menus.
reviews.title: Absolutely unique!

reviews.text: The elephant back safaris were a thrill: seated on Sebakwe, a 30 years old & 3 meters elephant! At night it was even more magic, under the stars. We learned a lot about those social animals.
reviews.title: Good....but actually a bit disappointing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gamedrives with our ranger Reineke were very exciting too. He always took on his time to teach us about the secret of the bush.
reviews.title: You MUST go to Camp Jabulani!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the HOESC were we were lucky enough to cuddle some baby cheetas!
reviews.title: Amazing and magical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jabulani Camp is really a must-do in SA. We saw a lot of animals and enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: I traveled with a large family group to Camp Jabulani in June. It was an amazing place to begin our game drives. Our hosts met us at the airport, and from then on we did not need to lift a finger. The food was very good/excellent, and the chef gladly accommodated any special requests. We were traveling with 9 children so that was important. We all loved the elephants of course. It was surreal to travel on the elephants to the sundowner camps set up for us each night!
reviews.title: Luxury at Camp Jabulani

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were beautiful and very well appointed. That being said, they were rather dark.
reviews.title: Excellent Game Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two things I would like to point out- ask for hot water bottles in the early morning/evening drives-they really help with the chill. Also, we went long periods between meals, so request a few snacks to take out with you.
reviews.title: The Absolute Best Part of our Honeymoon!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would go back to this beautiful place in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.text: Excellent and exclusive resort, which I can recommend especially for couples seeking for privacy. Service, food and atmosphere are excellent. Also you contribute to the preservation of the wildlife with your stay. We have been to many luxury resorts in South Africa and this is definitely among the best.
reviews.title: Its All About Me! And You! You will feel treasured...

reviews.text: Luxury can only go so far and with it you need great service. The service and friendliness at Camp Jabulani was impeccable at all times. From the Rangers to the restaurant staff and the room maids everyone was superb. Even the Elephants are on their best behaviour! I stayed two nights with my wife, parents and sister and we all enjoyed ourselves. We seemed to manage to experience the majority of the Rangers - Kyle, Kelvin, Stephan and Dave in the Jeeps and Ian for the Elephant back safari's and all were most friendly and knowledgable as you'd expect. I had two Elephant back Safari's with Foster at the helm and I have to say riding an Elephant is an experience I'll never forget - amazing! All the meals at breakfast, lunch and dinner are worthy of top restaurants, Cheri is one great chef. Although we didn't see all the Big 5 game the stay was fantastic.
reviews.title: Complete luxury in the bush

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has been some time, but I will always remember our stay at Camp Jabulani.
reviews.title: Absolute TOP !

reviews.text: Everything was TOP, I don't have enough words to express my experiences. From the pick up at the airport to the departure, was absolutely superb.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: It is definitely worth its money, and indeed it is not cheep.
reviews.title: Best place ever

reviews.text: We went in November in 2010 and the weather was luckaly not too warm so we had to ask to light the open fire in the room. That was a unforgettable moment. Romance at its top.
reviews.title: Leads the pack in the top ten bracket of Game Lodges. The Cheetah rehabilitation Centre is a Must see.
A "must"... for memories that will last a lifetime
reviews.text: Camp Jabulani was an incredible family experience... if you have to save for five years for this trip, it will be worth every cent. We are a family of five with our oldest having autism. He was definitely nervous at first, but ended up loving it so much. The sunset elephant safari was better than we expected, the quiet foot steps of these huge animals brought all of the other animal sounds so close. The staff was absolutely the best, the chef was accomodating to our picky eaters as well as making outstanding unique meals for my "try anything" husband. The zebra's, giraffe's, rhino's, etc... were comfortable with the thousands of pictures we took. More than perfect accomodations. Thank you Camp Jabulani!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Camp Jabulani exceeded all of our expectations on all levels. The main lodge areas are gorgeous and well done. I loved seeing all the wildlife just hanging up near the lodge and pathways. The rooms are large and beautiful with super comfy beds, fireplace and a large tub with great body products. The staff is wonderful and will accommodate every need - mine was to be with the ellies as much and as long as possible. Chef is fabulous!!!! She will make whatever you desire. We saw wonderful wildlife and our guide was fantastic BUT it is all about the elephants and that is why you go here. We had a truly amazing experience, so up close and personal with these incredible animals ...it is a life changing
reviews.title: It's all about the elephants!

reviews.text: experience and I highly recommend it. Go, go now and give Jabu a big hug and kiss from me!
reviews.title: Part of the trip of my lifetime

reviews.text: Jabulani was a big part of the trip of my lifetime. Travelling with members of 3 different generations isn't always easy but in this case we were all in total agreement : Jabulani is the superlative safari experiece. Attention to detail is the first comment that comes to mind. It is present in everything. The food is memorable, the decor is enchanting, the safari rides with Rey were perfect, the elephants are so amazing....
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing in every way! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Life is made of experiences and this one is at the top of my list.
reviews.title: There aren't enough superlatives to describe this wonderful place!

description: Camp Jabulani represents the epitome of style, luxury, gastronomic excellence and warm hospitality. The camp was conceptualized to sustain twelve orphaned and abandoned elephants. The intimate environment is designed to blend with the surrounding bush. Within the camp are a spa, lounge, dining area, and 6 exclusive suites. The Zindoga Villa suits the family traveller, groups or those who seek complete privacy and exclusivity.
